column8: text

http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...selidik-rafizi/Jangan syok sendiri, kata Dr Mahathir selepas kaji selidik RafiziSean Augustin | May 25, 2017Pengerusi PPBM itu ditanya mengenai hasil kaji selidik yang diumumkan Rafizi Ramli semalam.KUALA LUMPUR: Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad berkata senarai calon perdana menteri paling popular seperti yang diumumkan Naib Presiden PKR Rafizi Ramli semalam tidak membawa apa-apa makna sekiranya pembangkang tidak memenangi pilihan raya akan datang.“Kalau tak menang, sesiapa pun tak boleh jadi PM. Yang utama, menang. Kalau nak jadi calon, siapa pun boleh jadi,” katanya selepas program ceramah di Kampung Baru malam tadi.Semalam, Rafizi memberikan butiran hasil kajian oleh Invoke Malaysia yang diketuainya, melibatkan hampir 18,000 responden, bagi menunjukkan siapa pilihan menjadi perdana menteri sekiranya Pakatan Harapan menang pada pilihan raya umum akan datang.Rafizi berkata sebanyak 31% daripada mereka mahu mengekalkan Datuk Seri Najib Razak sebagai perdana menteri, sementara 34.6% membuat pelbagai pilihan daripada 9 orang pemimpin pembangkang, termasuk dirinya, manakala selebihnya tidak menjawab.Pemimpin tertinggi PKR, Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim mendapat sokongan paling banyak, iaitu 23.5%, diikuti Presiden PAS Datuk Seri Abdul Hadi Awang dengan undian 17.6%, Dr Mahathir (16.5%), dan Presiden PPBM, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin (12.6%).Dr Mahathir berpendapat kajian seumpama itu lebih sesuai selepas Pakatan memenangi pilihan raya.“Bila menang boleh buatlah. Kalau tak menang, bubuh nama, itu syok sendiri,” katanya kepada wartawan.Sebelum ini, perselisihan tercetus antara PKR dan pemimpin pembangkang lain selepas perwakilan PKR membuat gimik sepanduk tertera “Anwar PM ke-7”, pada kongres parti yang dihadiri Dr Mahathir dan pemimpin PPBM lain.Ia mengundang kritikan Ketua Pemuda PPBM Syed Saddiq Syed Abdul Rahman yang berkata PKR tidak sensitif, di samping kritikan bekas menteri Datuk Zaid Ibrahim yang mengundang kecaman Rafizi.Dalam wawancara ekslusif bersama FMT baru-baru ini, Dr Mahathir berkata sebarang rancangan melantik perdana menteri perlu mematuhi kedaulatan undang-undang.“Kita berjuang untuk menegakkan kedaulatan undang-undang. Tetapi, jika (selepas) berkuasa kita tidak mematuhinya, apa hak kita untuk menegur orang lain yang tidak mengikut undang-undang?” soalnya.Anwar kini menjalani hukuman penjara 5 tahun, dan tidak dibenarkan bertanding dalam pilihan raya untuk 5 tahun selepas dibebaskan.

An overwhelming majority of Malaysiakini's readers have endorsed Dr Mahathir Mohamad as Pakatan Harapan's prime minister candidate.According to the 12,777 who voted in the new portal's poll, 8,926 (69.9 percent) said Mahathir should be made a candidate while 3,276 (25.6 percent) disagreed.A small group answered "not sure" or "didn't care" in the poll, which ran for six days since May 19.As the poll was conducted in three languages, the results showed different voting patterns among the various demographics.Respondents who took part in the English-language version were the most supportive of naming Mahathir as a candidate for the premiership, compared to Bahasa Malaysia or Mandarin readers.Of those who answered the English-language poll, 76.6 percent were in favour of naming Mahathir as prime ministerial candidate while 68.6 percent of those who answered through the Bahasa Malaysia poll voted the same.However, only 51 percent of those who answered the Chinese-language poll backed Mahathir for the top post, with 43.9 percent disagreeing.One of the reasons for the Chinese poll results could be related to Mahathir's words and deeds during his tenure as prime minister, for example, the Suqiu election appeals issue.In 2000, even DAP supremo Lim Kit Siang, who has since buried the hatchet with Mahathir, lambasted the former premier over the Suqiu matter.After accepting Suqiu's election appeal, which included a review of the National Economic Policy, Mahathir, following the 1999 polls, had likened the movement to the communists.Another reason for the lack of support among Chinese readers is perhaps because they prefer jailed opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim to helm the nation.Harapan has been under pressure of late over their nominee for prime minister, with BN claiming that this proves that the opposition coalition was not united.Read more: https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/383457#ixzz4i4wraZEFLel.. now what....
